CatDescriptText: Mrs. Marlene H. Franklin, 7144 Lemington Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "It doesn't make me any difference so far as the street cars are concerned. I don't care if they never begin running again.  I've become used to riding to and from work in a car and I find that it's more comfortable than a street car."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marlene Harris Franklin wearing coat with large buttons and brooch, standing with fingertips touching in front of light colored wall with pipe and peeling paint
